p: Norovirus was originally identified in 1968 from an outbreak of ‘winter vomiting disease’ in Norwalk, Ohio. The disease manifests in self-limiting fulminant vomiting, diarrhoea and low-grade fever lasting from 24 to 48 h [84]. It is estimated that, per year, norovirus prompts ∼900000 hospital visits in the developed world and an estimated 200 000 deaths of children under 5 years of age in the developing world [85].
